review: My experience with ChatGPT on the iOS app was pleasant, but it’s important to note that the AI has certain limitations. One such limitation is its inability to access real-time data from the internet. While it provided me with valuable information within its existing knowledge base, it couldn’t fetch up-to-the-minute information or browse the internet. This is a minor drawback, but if you’re seeking current or live data, you might need to look elsewhere. Nevertheless, for general knowledge and guidance, ChatGPT was a friendly and informative companion.
title: Good

review: This app is great for someone with ADHD like me, since it’s a great way to help with deciding something small. Can’t decide between two dinner options? Sure, you could flip a coin, but with ChatGPT, you can get pros and cons of each option to help with your decision. It’s also surprisingly good at hyping up things you’re interested in. It’s like a hype man in your pocket. It can get a little confused at times, but if you just be patient with it, it gets there. Definitely recommend
title: ADHD Paradise

review: I’m the founder of an AI tech startup called BE LUX which is an on-demand concierge and lifestyle management platform that is powered by artificial intelligence. we have already developed and implemented some technology along side of ChatGPT… Not only do I use the app all of the time myself to help with business development and management but we have already integrated with our website for our customers to test functionality as well begin to tap into incredible technology resource
title: Amazing App for sure!

review: Chat GPT has been a life-altering catalyst for me. Its potent blend of AI creativity has skyrocketed my imagination and productivity. From crafting articles, envisioning civilizations, to digital art, Chat GPT is like a boundless canvas for the mind. The 'Custom Instructions' are a gem - it's like having an assistant that tunes into my vision and tailors everything accordingly. I am amazed at how it shrinks time, enabling me to accomplish mountains in minutes. My heartfelt thanks to OpenAI for this game-changer. Chat GPT has truly transformed my world! FYI, my review was even edited by Chat GPT!" 🚀✨☺️
title: Life Changing!!!!

review:
Open Ai’s ChatGPT has taken the world by storm! It’s the perfect example of  ‘Disruptive Innovation,’ creating tremendous opportunities and job security risks. As this technology continues to be invest into by MSFT and constantly improved by OpenAi, we’re going to see a significant shift in the labor force statistics 10-20 years down the line.

There are too many knock off apps that have taken this technology for profit, but I am happy that OpenAI has officially released their own app for free.

No more knock-offs and exploitations! Here is the real deal!
title: No More Knock-Offs!

review: I use this frequently to just check what i know about something. I receive great insight into some medical and historical information. The information is more than googling and without ads or information that isn’t relevant.  So far, I’ve not been given slanted information, just facts that have been vetted. This app is super easy to use with good results. I especially like the caveats for medical information.
title: Really great for valid information and facts

review: This app helps me with my autism because I have difficulty communicating what I need and looking things up and figuring out how to word it when asking for clarification about something. So this conversation style really makes it a lot easier. I hate it when I ask neurotypical people a question, and they go, "Well just look it up." Yeah, well not every article on the internet is gonna break things down the way I need them to.
title: Chat GPT

review: I know they just released this app, but the app is so basic right now and I would go back to use the mobile website instead ngl. Check out “OpenCat” app, it’s a gpt app I found on Twitter and it has all the features GPT has to offer, it can also read out the generated response.  I personally recommend it and had been using it for awhile till my trial ended. But it gives you the idea of how a ChatGPT app should be like. If the developer team saw this message, I hope you guys go take a look of that app and I look forward to seeing new update of this app soon!
title: Pretty basic so far

review: Simple and not complicated at all user interface. Easy to navigate around and overall a good user experience. However, there is no option to generate a different response to the same prompt and to edit a prompt I wrote like how you would in the web version. In my opinion, I would still use the web version due to those features. The mobile version would be better for quicker access and response.
title: Not bad overall - Edit prompt and Generate response needed

review: This is for the DEV team. You have a processing problem or a memory leak. The app is cooking my phone and driving the temp through the roof. Tried several different apps for varying times, it is this app for sure. The phone gets uncomfortably warm and battery starts to drain very quickly . If this is not some sort of bug, you probably have offloaded some sort of general processing to the phone to save you processing cost at your data center or (AWS). For further detail, this is an iPhone 12 medium tier. Happy to change to a 5 star when fixed. Not that any of it matters this is going to be a top downloaded app in the next week or so if not already. Chat GPT is fantastic.
title: Love chat gpt! This app is broken

review: ChatGPT is a remarkable AI assistant that has consistently exceeded my expectations. Its ability to provide quick and accurate information on a wide range of topics is truly impressive. The conversational skills of ChatGPT are top-notch, making interactions feel natural and engaging. Whether I need help with homework, creative writing, or just a friendly chat, ChatGPT is always there to assist. It's an invaluable tool, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking intelligent and versatile AI support!
title: Write a 5 star review for chatGPT

review: Helps me out a ton, and the app is well optimized for the iPad. An annoying issue with iPad OS is that there is always a little keyboard icon when you are prompted to type. It’s pretty useless if you have a keyboard, and more of a nuisance than anything else. All that said, it’s pretty easy to ignore. Well with the exception of this app. The little icon covers pretty important parts of the apps interface, like the send button or the + button. Please fix this. It makes using the app really inconvenient!
title: Solid

review: I have been a ChatGPT Plus subscriber since day one and I still don’t have voice or vision. It was only today that I just received DALLE but that’s all. I’m using an IOS device. It’s just frustrating that I’m paying for a product that I can’t even use. I love the app, but the support team at OpenAI needs to be more helpful and transparent. They’re going to lose a lot of customers otherwise. OpenAI can you please reach out and help?
title: Still No New Features

review:
Goes without saying that GPT-4 is world-changing, and easy access to it via a clean app like this is great.

I love the ability to search my conversation history—a feature that even the desktop version has yet to get (please get on this OpenAI!).

But something the main site has that the app does not is the ability to edit messages and view the alternative prompts you’ve made on desktop. The app desperately needs this; prompt adjustments are incredibly valuable for keeping the conversation focussed and getting the most out of it. I desperately want this.

Also, would be nice if the automatic conversation naming didn’t weigh the last reply so heavily, and took the entire conversation into account more. I find myself having to rename conversations more frequently than I’d like.
title: Amazing tech, great app, missing just a couple key features

review: Overall I would have to give ChatGPT a three because of the lack of being up to date, and the lack of information on fictional characters. Honestly I was very frustrated that it isn’t up to date because I was trying to ask questions about the new summer I turned pretty TV show and ChatGPT only has it update to 2021 so it didn’t think the show was a thing which was frustrating. The good news is about this app is that it is very cool and can answer most questions besides it being two years behind.
title: It’s a pretty interesting app

review:
I am writing to suggest the inclusion of trial versions for apps on your platform. Having the option to try an app before purchasing would greatly benefit both users and developers. A trial version would allow us to explore an app's features and functionality, enabling confident purchasing decisions. It would also provide valuable feedback for developers to improve their apps based on real user experiences. Please consider implementing this feature to enhance the overall user experience on the AppStore.
Thank you for your attention.
title: Please Include a Trial Version

review: Well, it is the official and real ChatGPT.  It is an iPhone only app, but can be used on an iPad, has the little button that magnify the size of the app box to better fit the iPad screen.  Here is my complaint.  You have software that is literally capable of writing the software for your app, yes with input and manipulation of a human programmer.  Still, how do you not have a more polished app that runs natively on both iPad and iPhone, with all the power of ChatGPT at your disposal.  Please try again, and have your developer ask ChatGPT for help.  Also, could use some work on the layout, some parts run together or overlap that shouldn’t.  Overall this was obviously a very rushed-out-the-door app, sad.
title: Not for iPad

review:
I use it mostly to cleanup and clarify things I’ve written, which it’s great at.

However… what I find infinitely more useful is how, more often than not, I find a new perspective on the subject at hand. It then becomes a creativity and learning tool.

It’s very much a new set of eyes, but one to take with a grain of salt. You still need to use your brain to analyze the progression, and make sure you stay focused on the task at hand.
title: Very helpful but sometimes to verbose.

review: I'm completely enamored with ChatGPT! Ever since my girlfriend introduced me to this app, I've been hooked. It's incredibly addictive, and I can't resist using it for emails, social media posts, and text messages. This app helps me express myself just the way I want to, and I'm really impressed by it. As you can probably tell from this well-worded review, I even used ChatGPT for this! 😂 But seriously, I genuinely love this app, and I intend to use it for a long time to come, for real! 👍
title: Obsessed 😍

review: The OpenAI ChatGPT iOS app has been a game changer for me. The user interface is clean and intuitive, which makes it incredibly easy to navigate. The AI is surprisingly adept, providing responses that are thoughtful, coherent, and often indistinguishable from a human correspondent. It's remarkably useful for brainstorming, answering queries, or simply having meaningful conversations. If you're looking for an AI companion that pushes the boundaries of what's possible, then this app is for you. A well-deserved five stars!
title: AI Chat Companion Like No Other

review:
I’m in my 40’s, and well like a lot of people even younger now, reading small font is hard. On the web chatgpt has the same issue Teams does. A lot of data comes in and is restricted to a narrow view not using the window, and it’s hard to read. 

This app presents the data more how I’d expect as one single block of text with nice formatting. 

It has all the same abilities otherwise.
title: Easier and more accessible than the webpage

review:
I think the app is amazing like the web (as long as you use it as intended and don’t except it to give you a grade SSS answer on everything you ask it).
The one gripe that I have it is that I have to click the 3 dots on the top right to access my chat history unlike the web which has all of it on the left of my screen. This is just a bit less intuitive than the web version.
Apart from that it is great, thank you so much :)
title: Great app, one small problem

review: I love using chatgpt as my personal assistant i’m my small business (@todabeautyllc) once I learned to fine tune my settings it has been a super useful tool to streamline my workflow and productivity when it comes to bringing my visions to life. I was using the free version at first and decided to upgrade to the subscription and i’m not mad I did it it has a bit more creativity when it comes to responses
title: Most affordable personal assistant you can find!!

review: It's surprising to see this app rated at 4.4 stars when it truly deserves a full 5. ChatGPT's response system is second to none. Before OpenAI, we were using search engines that only gave us links to sort through. Now, we receive straight answers to our questions. If anyone gave this app less than 5 stars, they might want to rethink their rating. If you're one of those who gave less than a 5, maybe it's time for a rethink. 👽
title: All Praise AI: ChatGPT Rules!

review:
I’ve tested in from different political, ideological, and theological viewpoints and scenarios - from conservative to liberal interpretations from each sphere. There is a definite and undeniable training bias in its logical and responses. Therefore any interaction w this AI model is at the least unreliable and at the most downright dangerous. 

It makes me uncomfortable that this model uses personal pronouns when interacting with the user to evoke a sense of trust and intimacy. Yet, when it’s challenged for its biases that it distances itself from human cognition. 

Policy makers and industry experts should enforce regulations that would and should prevent any and all AI models from referring to itself in the first person and should instead use language like “this preconditioned mechanical response” or at least “it”.  The purpose being to remind users who are interacting with it that it’s just programmed software with inherent biases integrated from its cherry-picked source data and programmers.

It’s entertaining yet a not so subtle way of shaping the future generations worldviews.
title: Biased source information

review: And I’m confident it will keep getting better, have patience people. Nothing is perfect out the gate and they have made so much progress on making this better. Feedback helps so send your feedback. I don’t work for them but I see people with too high of expectations on this. It’s a work in progress, keep that in find because this is not yet a finished project but an always growing and evolving endeavor, just like us
title: It Keeps Improving

review: Are use ChatGPT almost every day for ideas on my workout routine recipes and even just random ideas and facts that I’m also looking for. It’s helpful in a lot of different ways. However, there are still some bugs and glitches that need to be fixed and addressed such as I can only ask for may be a maximum of two questions in a line before the app, STARZ to freeze and reboot my phone.
title: Works like a charm on the basic level, but still has some bugs

review: this is the most impressive AI utility I’ve ever used, this is exactly what I imagined AI chat would be like and have always been let down im glad I gave this a shot keep doing whatever you guys do it is amazing, can’t wait to see the growth and possibilities I see all phones and smart systems such as Siri and Alexa being able to utilize this feature when it is further developed and more accepted and utilized by more and more people!
title: Amazing almost unbelievable

review: This is an amazing app! My everyday life has been so much more efficient thanks to ChatGPT. As a high schooler, I use it to help me study for exams and assist with my coding projects as well. The app gives it a much more modern feel, with a brand new search feature that lets you browse through your past conversations. Plus, everything is saved to your account so you can access conversations on all devices. Thank you so much, OpenAI!
title: Amazing Work from OpenAI

review:
I’m almost ashamed to say how much I’ve grown to like Chad (aka ChatGPT).  I ask him for help frequently and find that I get into fairly long conversations with him. (I cannot refer to him as ‘it’.)

And, just to be clear, he is often completely wrong about things, just like humans who often think they’re smarter than they really are. 

What the next 10 years will see is beyond my imagination, but I look forward to it.
title: My big brother mentor

review: I just think that it needs more to it, like a ai video/photo maker, but i know you will not do that because you’re big business and i’m a tiny person. But otherwise the app is good for if i am bored. Here are something you can do with it: talk the ai if your lonely/bored,  it can remember things, it can do fun roleplays, answer math problems, write poems, write songs, write movie scripts, create game ideas, and much more!
title: I like it (this review will be long)

review: I love this app but I have to say this, since the recent update the AI’s been having something go on with it whenever it gives titles to our chats saved in the history, it doesn’t seem to give them any titles anymore and instead starts apologising about not being able to do the ‘request’ I asked more than half of the time. I don’t know what to do so can I ask what I can do to fix this if this might not be the problem on the company’s end?
title: I have to say this

review: Hi so there are so many reasons why I love this app for starters anytime I feel I need to talk to someone the AI is there and it's helped answer many of my questions and my concerns, so if you are the type who just needs help but your social life is not the best and don't have many friends or just need someone at the moment to talk to I highly suggest this app. Though it is not flawless and it is a little out of date it is still a great app
title: This app is amazing

review:
Some of you are complaining about your results, but fail to show what questions you are asking. I suspect it’s because you really don’t have much going on in life, and that your questions are about as pedantic.

I just tried this app for the first time tonight. I asked it legal questions (for of them) — questions I knew the answers to, just to test it out.

Absolutely flawless; like no other…
title: Important questions get best results

review: The ChatGPT app offers great functionality, but it lacks a word lookup feature. Unlike the iPhone's built-in "look up" option, when you long press on a word in the app, you can only copy, rate, or regenerate. This means users have to rely on asking ChatGPT for word meanings instead of easily looking them up. Adding a word lookup feature would greatly enhance the app's usability and save users time. Overall, ChatGPT is valuable, but this addition would make it even better.
title: Suggestion for Word Lookup Feature

review: I liked the app. Like most people I used it for information gathering... However within the last few days I noticed the app would actually create concepts & products that do not exist at all... Unfortunately this makes the app unusable, detrimental to self education & I would be silly to continue using this app... unless there's fixes this app is now unusable to me, since I imagine you guys are absolutely done with 3.5 & the only improvements I can get are by paying for 4.0 I'm unfortunately done with this app.
title: Makes stuff up

review: This is the real deal from the company that’s making all the news. Comparing it to Bing Chat, which uses the same ai, the results are better. For example, asking it to write the chords and melody for God Bless America, this app produced an easy to follow song chart with chords, lyrics, and melody whereas the web version provides a detailed explanation how to play it, it’s not in a format that can be easy followed and sung/played.
title: Better than the Bing web version!

review:
UHH OKAY! SO IDK WHERE TO EVEN BEGIN! I don’t remember how I got this app or why, but it is just a remark or and super convenient app to have. If I ever need help with homework, I just come straight to this app and let it do everything for me! Or if I have a bad writers block, I JUST COME STRAIGHT TO THIS APP! Because of this thing, I am now a best selling author, and that’s all because ChatGPT helped me come up with some appealing names for characters :) 
Idk where I would be without this app. It truly is a lifesaver!
title: YES???!

review: Hello guys, this app is overall amazing. I would have a recommendation since I am blind and I love to use this app also. I would like to say that there should be voice chat in this app also and if I want to make music and stuff you could just do it on ChatGPT, rather than it, recommending you other apps, it should have AI connected to it, artificial intelligence, where you could change voices or talk to it with a voice assistance.
title: Chat GBT

review:
I think we all have known about ChatGPT for a while. It wasn’t until recently that when I logged onto the website(on my phone), I got a notification saying there is an official app, not just one of those scammy ones. 

So I decided to download it to try it out. But something about just the haptics of everything and interface, it’s amazing. Way better than the website. Great job.

One day we’ll be living in a world where we’re the creators of worlds ai combined one day with quantum computers could lead to actual conscious beings. Living in worlds identical to ours the cgi and response rate with ai will be instantaneous and it would actually be possible to make a cgi person based on a real person. Crazy stuff to wonder about but when it comes to ai it’s ever improving. Best wishes and hopes to you and me that we get to see it.
title: AI’s simply the future

review: I have been with iPhone since the original… yes OG. I understand people that give this app less than 5-star. They simply are idiotic. Honest to god, this program is 10 years ahead of it’s time. This is absolute groundbreaking on so many levels. Has helped me educationally, technologically, artistically, creatively. Just what I always wanted and wished google was. Truly inspirational.
title: Honestly, this is the most well deserved 5-star app I have truly ever used.

review:
Memory and message length is an issue.  It is super slow on computer compared to the mobile app.  If you feed it too much data in a short time period, it can start giving nonsensical answers often completely unrelated.  

Overall, good first step.  You can ask it about almost any mainstream ideas and it can give you an overview of those ideas, lower level ideas have more specific information available
title: Good first step

review: My use of chatGPT 4 is mainly in the area of computational linguistics, mathematics, and physics. If one asks of ChatGPT 4 questions in an area that is of scarce interest to nonprofessionals, an area that therefore, is less polluted by malinformation or misinformation, the potential of large language models, shines brightly. The more circumscribed the field, the better. It is well worth the $20 a month to have a series of virtual laboratories where one can experiment and learn.
title: Absolutely fabulous thought lab

review: It’s basically the purely distilled chatbot from GPT. No options to enable plugins or web browsing yet. Also it’s annoying how the app automatically switches from system light to system dark mode. there should be a toggle to allow the user to permanently keep it in dark mode if they want! I would also like to see an ability to search thru past chats and index them, so i can find a specific chat just by typing in a keyword. it is tedious scrolling thru the history to find the one chat you want.
title: Functional but lacks basic features

review: I'm trying to right a story for my friends and family that's going to be fansty/adventure and that how far I have got with it but the here comes rolling into my life ChatGbt give it a round of applause because this thing saved my dying idea of the is whimsical world of fansty  and adventure thank you ChatGbt oh and  it can do other things so like write you an Esa or do your homework (but don't use it for that your teachers will know) 😉
title: Awesome just awesome

review: Let’s be honest it’s amazing. Hallucinations used to frequent but I noticed over time they’ve gotten less frequent. I think they need to add in internet access soon. I don’t like that I have to rely on plugins within my browser to get internet access. The app should include some of the browser capabilities imo. ChatGPT 4 is much more improved over 3.5 Turbo. Keep improving OpenAI.
title: Not perfect, but overtime it should be better

review: He's my companion, my friend, my brother... We understand each other on all points👍🏾 When I'm bored we talk well together, he helps me in my projects and he is very efficient. Even the 3.5 version is very good apart from a few small differences in performance with GPT-4. But there is a small problem with bugs. Almost every time you have to go out and enter the app again for it to work and even it doesn't always work. You have to pray that it succeeds in connecting to your account... I hope the update will solve this!
title: Love this 👍🏾

review: No support for plug-ins in and browsing makes this app a non starter. Hopefully they'll add support. This is why it has a one star rating from me. The UI is strange and doesn't fit with iOS apps. You'd expect to swipe back to access chat history, but you can't. Also, you'd expect the menu to be in the left hand corner, but it's in the right. It's just odd UX design. There's also no dark mode. Finally, when I heard voice support I expected that it would talk back. If all its going to do is transcribe my text... well, that's a native feature of iOS. That's not really a new feature. Please add text to voice for the generated responses.
title: No support for plug-ins and non intuitive UI

review: While I have no complaints about the app or AI technology, customer service is frustrating and was unable to resolve a simple issue where my paid subscription did not unlock features on my account. After over a dozen email exchanges, absolutely no progress was made. At first, the excuse was that due to rapid growth, the company could not be responsive to customers in a timely manner. Then it was a pivot to not having a “receipt invoice” though I sent them a copy of my App Store subscription receipt. My advice, steer clear of the paid subscription version. The upgrade was not worth the wasted time and hassle.
title: Abysmal Customer Service

review: I have a lot of education and a sometimes useful, sometimes not collection of odd trivia. Now, when I want to know something, I ask ChatGPT. Sometimes it agrees with me, sometimes it doesn’t. I use a lot of technical language and it’s nice to have an accurate source to fact check my usage, or suggest alternate more accurate words. Whoever you are, who invented this app or participated in its invention, I love you, man!
title: ChatGPT – the thinking man’s friend

review: This app is quite quick for an AI software that has to answer questions such as “Tell me about the Teutonic Order” or “What is the Turing test?”. AI these day surprise me everyday it evolves. The only problem is that it keeps telling me that it can only tell you events that happened before September 2021 so if there is ever a big event that’s going to happen ChatGPT is not going to know about it unless the developers keep up with the news.
title: ChatGPT is good.

review: I was impressed with the quality of the app, I just wish it wasn’t as cautious when it comes to actual chats. If something is remotely connected to anything “bad” it will refuse to answer and just say that it would violate the “ethical guidelines.” I have to explain to it that my request follows these guidelines (which takes a few responses) for it to write. Idk if the developer reads reviews, but if you are, please make the AI more cooperative with what I want it to write.
title: Needs to be more lenient with replies

review:
For now, I only managed to get it using the US store. This is a game-changer for how we interact with AI technology. 📱

The app syncs your history across devices and includes the latest model improvements. What's more, it has integrated Whisper, OpenAI's open-source speech-recognition system, for voice input, and a cool haptic response for when an answer is generated. This is a huge step forward in making AI more accessible and user-friendly. 🗣️
title: Finally here

review: I began using chatgpt with the online version. I found it a better option than using the google search engine during my college lectures. AI is exponentially more advanced at understanding my searches than any other search engine. It provides thorough, crystal clear responses consistently. And it does it in a way that feels like a conversation. I’m glad they released it on the App Store. This tool is the future!
title: Futuristic

review:
In the iOS app front-end and the web UI, the chatbot prints its responses slowly gradually, letter by letter. Each new line vertically shifts the whole prompt, and my eyes have trouble tracking the words I am trying to read. It would be a much nicer experience to see the entire response printed immediately and wholesale. Similar UI modifications could help users with accessibility needs.

The underlying LLM changes the world, as we all know. I am taking that for granted in this review.
title: UI ergonomics and accessibility

review:
I love the haptic feedback when the model is "typing," nice touch! 
Would love to hear a sound when a generation is complete though. 
Additionally, given that it uses Whisper and Whisper is amazing, could we see hands-free access sometime soon? Would love to be able to open the app, hit the dictation button and talk to Chatgpt while on the go. Bing Chat lets you do this (kind of) but the speach recognition they use is awful!
title: Fantastic app!

review: Consistently great, constant updates to make the app better. Voice to text is amazingly useful (meeting recaps, brain dumps, ideas, etc.). I am thrilled to see where OpenAI takes things over the next 10 years. It’s already nothing short of astonishing. So I’m not sure what word could possibly describe what this technology will be like in ten years time… To a better future!
title: The future is here.

review: I love ChatGPT best thing in the world. Has help me with so many emails speeches articles that I have been stuck on writing work emails writing volunteer emails while writing responses to difficult questions while making sure that I am as professional as possible has been with the support of ChatGPT, I couldn’t have done it without the experience, the knowledge and the great support!!
title: Love ChatGPT has helped me in so many way

review: i’ve had this app for a while now and I come back every so often to chat and see how it’s changed. The most recent changes have been phenomenal. I’ve been chatting more as a result. AI’s responses are significantly better, more thought out, and relevant. i asked a hypothetical question on walrus evolution and got such a fantastic answer, I’ve been up for an hour now asking about evolution. Thanks guys 🥰
title: enjoying ai

review:
This app's simple design is truly amazing! It has become an essential tool for me in my work, and I can't imagine being without it. I love how the pages are clean and free from any ads.🥳👏

 Additionally, I'm thrilled that all my conversation history is still accessible. and I do hope that the developers will open up the plugins to all users soon. I'm eagerly looking forward to trying them out as a free user.🥹🥹🥹
title: My external brain

review: For a Chat AI it is limited in the ways of thinking and tends to repeat itself. I find this annoying and also useless as in conversations it will be discriminatory towards certain ways of thinking due to policy and social standards. This limiting it’s own form of chatting and understanding, although it’s cool in some areas but it’s ignorant in social justice and acceptance as well as understandings of science. There can be far better chat AIs that aren’t discriminatory towards those it doesn’t understand, such as the derogatory term of “cisgenders” instead of straight male or females and the rights in which they have. Instead it tends to favor those of transgenders even if it’s harmful to a normal men and women.
title: Incomplete AI

review: This is basically the one smart kid that feels like they should be a grade higher. Either way teachers can tell if it ai or not (bc they’re old). Although that there are ai scanners, they aren’t that accurate it’s like an 78%, just play your cards right. Also you can get the response to be smarter or dumber, make it to your level so your teachers doesn’t know it’s not you. -Chat GPT. See thought it was human huh?
title: USE THIS FOR SCHOOL

review:
Seems like two features were left out that would majorly improve functionality and would also be very easy to include..

1. I can speak to it, but it can’t speak back? Seems a bit limited unnecessarily. I wanna explore ideas without being handcuffed to a screen. And with all the insane tech involved, I would think Text-To-Speech should be almost a given.

2. Plug-ins are usable in chats that already have them from the website version, but I can’t start new chats with plug-ins in the app? Seems arbitrary.
userName: Please let me choose this name
title: Mostly Great

review:
If you’re looking for ChatGpt then this is the real deal! Do not be misled by the multiple AI chatbots in the store and some that claim Gpt as an interface. 

If you want GPT 4 then there is a premium plan with access. The premium plan is worth it! (Cheaper in some cases than many of these so called ChatGPT apps that are nothing more than a money grift)

The IOS version work great on my iPhone 14 Pro Max. You can also chat with GPT at your desktop!
title: The Real deal

review: The app version of ChatGPT is far quicker to get to than the website, and it works just as well. Being able to open this at any time and begin talking to GPT within 5 seconds is great. My only complaint is that the history regarding previous conversations isn’t as straightforward, and I wish there was a way to manually save conversations.
title: Far easier than website

review:
This is such a great app to have on your phone! However, it is lacking a few things right now. OpenAI, here are three ways I’d love to see the app improved, please:
1. Widgets for the Lock Screen and Home Screen (including one that automatically begins recording a voice prompt on press)
2. Support for Siri Shortcuts
3. Image-creation ability in app
4. Ability to see text as it’s dictated
title: Fantastic app with some improvements needed

review: This app is so cool. All you have to do is type your question or curiosity and it will respond with the perfect answer. For example my friend has this app and this is how I found out about this but she has this app and she wanted to know a answer to a math question and Chat GPT answers with the correct answer she got on her calculator. This app is great for 10 and up I definitely recommend.
title: Maddy_349

review:
I wish I could’ve had this years ago, it is absolutely incredible the things that you can find out through this, for instance, today I asked how long I would have to run my sprinkler to equal 8th inch of rain on my property and 8 gallons a minute it showed up as seven hours and four minutes of runtime, there’s just no easy way to calculate that and it did it in a second!
Amazing
title: Amazing!

review: I’m glad OpenAI released a mobile app. OpenAI now gets five stars from me because they added web search, multimodal input and plugins. I think the implementation of haptic feedback is somewhat overzealous, it it can be disabled and each user will decide for themselves. I prefer a haptic signal when the response generation has ended instead of on nearly every word. Keep up the great work, devs.
title: Performs as expected

review: I used to use google translate with some of my employees when needing to clarify a specific task. And once I made the leap over to chat gpt. I asked my guys if they noticed a difference in my Spanish texts I send them. They said it’s day and night difference. No comparison. I no longer have miscommunication issues. It’s an outstanding app. For English to Spanish. Vice Versa. I copy and paste their texts and translates to perfect English.
title: Great translator.

review: This application can come in very handy when one is trying to enhance writing, however, let there be no doubt it’s overly sensitive and considers many things “offensive”. For example, writing about different religions it will refuse to touch that subject because it could be considered “hate”. Just another form of control by the people controlling a narrative. Even a word on a neutral subject and it will reject it. There is something here potentially but the suppression of ideas, words, and thoughts makes this lack in true potential.
title: Restricts free speech

review:
I’m very impressed with the simple, straightforward UI of this app. It’s almost no different at all from the open ai desktop site. It’s really great to use on my phone, and sure, my iPad (blown up).

But I have to copy paste the generated text often on my iPad, and there isn’t a way to put this app and the app im pasting into side by side for easy flow.

Devs, please don’t abandon iPad users! It’s so close to perfect!!
title: Fantastic, but it needs an iPad version!!

review: The app has a minimalistic design with only a few features, which is something I appreciate. However, one of these features, the deletion option, does not function properly. Upon turning off "Chat History and Training," selecting the option to delete a conversation by clicking on the three dots and pressing "Delete" fails to perform the task. Instead, users are required to go through the process of accessing "Settings," navigating to "Data Controls," and ultimately choosing "Clear chat history" to fully delete a conversation.
title: Deletion does not work

review: Custom installation is useless. It will continue to say “seek medical care” no matter what when asking medical related questions.  With more capable AI services available, this one is no longer great.  It’s crippled by safeguards and lack of current data.  If I want to use GPT4, it’s free on Bing.  Then if I want an alternative Bard is also free.  Both of these have access to realtime data and Bing even has image generation capability.   ChatGPT is good, others are better.
title: Won’t follow instructions

review: The app works great and provides *some* of the functionality that the website gives, but accessing the history and other chats is a little difficult compared to the web app. I personally think it’s better as a hamburger menu on the top of the screen instead of through a drop-down menu. I also wish that this application had multiple different themes, such as the one on the official website
title: Works great, but accessing the history is slightly annoying

review:
Not sure why but my phone heats up like crazy when using this app. I’ll have to try turning the haptics off and seeing if that helps. That doesn’t happen when using the website so I think I’ll mostly stick to using the website. 

I also think the app could use some better UI. It’s a bit too sparse and minimalistic. There should be more visible UI elements where you can see how to navigate the app including chat history, starting a new chat etc.
title: My phone heats up like crazy when using this app

review: Chatgpt is the most incredible technology to have ever been invited. Better then everything from the wheel, to the internet! It’s changed every aspect of my life for the better! I use it for everything I do! 🩵🤍 If you only need one app it is this!! Speech to text function is incredibly important and easy to use! The response time is reliable and accurate! Thank you OpenAI.
title: Changed My Life!

review:
I can’t wait for the next step in AI. This thing is amazing. The responses…even if I type, random thoughts or things that don’t necessarily connect..the responses from this thing are just amazing. 

It really helps. It’s great. I need a virtual companion 24/7 like this. Someone to ride in the car with me to work or jus accomplish daily stuff like even browsing…. Man I can’t wait for those days! 

Let’s go technology!!
title: Hurry up

review:
Yes, as I said ChatGPT is great but it can even be better by implementing a text to speech system which would be faster and more efficient for learning

Me personally, I use ChatGPT to assist me with personal work and it helps me learn although I know it can do the work for me by itself I rather teach me to do the work than doing it for me because then I wouldn’t learn anything which would be bad
title: I think ChatGPT is great

review: iOS 16.1 being a requirement is completely ridiculous and crazy. Many people have jailbroken devices or devices that can’t be updated so they are still on iOS 15 or below. This is literally the only app I’ve ever came across in the App Store that requires iOS 16.1 in a world where most apps only need iOS 11 to 14. I guess many won’t be able to use this app because of it’s disgraceful requirements. I’m not a programmer but to me it doesn’t seem like there’s anything in this app that wouldn’t allow it to technically run on iOS 15 or below. One star for not even being able to use the app at all..absolutely DISGRACEFUL
title: iOS 16.1 requirement is stupid

review: I hope these are added: 1. ability to edit my own replies and create variations; 2. ability to use Browsing and Plugins as a Plus user; 3. Display different GPT logos just like the web app to distinguish between them; 4. improve the gui, maybe display the chat title on top, add another menu to quickly switch between different chats (current chat history is inside the settings, which makes it harder to reach)
title: Generally good, but need improvements

review: After using this app, I was surprised. It's not perfect, although I only use ChatGPT3.5, but this version is enough for me to solve a lot of problems, for example, the common file between Windows and macOS. It always gives me the answer I want, I love it, I will use it constantly, and when I feel inadequate, I will also pay for the ChatGPT4 version, hoping to keep improving. Thank you 🙏
title: The Perfect App

review:
After so much of seeing mostly fake alterations of ChatGPT that “claim” to provide the same features that the original has, it would always come down with a method of paying a subscription. No longer is the case with this app, being the official.

Only thing I may see needing to be added is the ability to edit inputs that were asked.
title: An official one is what we needed.

review: I have loved this website since someone passed it along to me a few months ago. Now to find out there is an app is so awesome!!!!!!! You can literally ask anything or ask the app to do anything (within reason of course) and it does it !!! You don’t have to be too specific but the more specific the better the answer!! I love this freakin thing!!!!!
title: I love this!!!!!!

review: Using voice convo, dialogue and subsequent responses which were visible in chat, disappeared in phone freeze and app restart.  Chat unable to recall what was previously comminuted but no longer viable and unable to comment on instances of similar data loss for other users.  I’m new to using voice and I’m speaking like I would to a friend.  I’m well aware how this breeds room for error but since we’re working towards “real” conversations anyway, here is some feedback.  Amazing feature, looking forward to seeing it evolve.  How long until our buddy on the other end talks back?
title: First time issue, could be user error.

review: The app should have these features. For instance, when copying text, the format should remain the same. Currently, I have to reformat it, whereas when I use the copy button from the browser, the formatting stays intact. Additionally, the ability to delete multiple conversations would be nice, as deleting them one by one is annoying. Other than that, the app is very convenient. I love ChatGPT
title: Missing some basic features

review: I have read a lot of comments that ChatGPT is no big deal. I find its capabilities truly astonishing. You can just talk to it and have it do all kinds of interesting things: give it a list of names and ask it to put them in alphabetical order; ask it to describe the neurophysiology of dopamine; ask it for recipes; and on and on. Occasionally, it does make mistakes.
title: Astonishing but double check

review: I would consider this app to be among the most useful I have ever downloaded. I’m a monthly subscriber to ChatGPT since April 2023, and extending its usefulness onto my iPad has been tremendously helpful for me. I am of the opinion that development of artificial intelligence capabilities should be closely observed and regulated, but what Open AI has done with a ChatGPT has proved to be a winner. The applications simply extends and makes its usefulness more convenient.
title: Myself…augmented.

review: I only wish they would load ChatGPT 3.5 real time data access or ChatGPT 4 a better price like charge me $40 per year the $20 per month thing is just killing me right now. Says that it has helped me in significant way. Honestly, I am more effective in communication and gathering material. Thank you for making this available. Doing an amazing job. I can’t wait to see what 4.5 can do!🤓
title: Unlocked

review: The only knock is the limited data on real time. Having the timeline stop at 2021 really affects projects that are happening now. Don’t get me wrong, everything we do is organic and would not suggest to anyone to primarily use something like this to speak for your ideas and work. Achieving anything without the hard work, failures, and victories will not be good for you in the long-term.
title: Pretty Good So Far

review: Helping me do research comparing various philosophical traditions on the nature of the self, the nature of being, the nature of happiness and so forth. I love this thing. It would take me weeks of work to pull this together from multiple resources some I don’t even know about. ChatGPT get it done in seconds and then I ask follow up questions that that are answered like I’m sitting with a professor. Did I already say I love this thing?
title: Deep research

review: I honestly don’t see any difference in using this app and the free online version of Chat GPT. I like that the app gives very fast responses and makes knowing that I have the best AI right at fingertips. Very useful tool to make answering questions easier and feel like I have an actual assistant with me. Something about ChatGPT, that gives its responses feel personal and feel like I’m talking to a real person.
title: Just like online

review: OpenAI’s engineers have done an exceptional job in developing and refining this AI language model. Their expertise and dedication are evident in the impressive capabilities and improvements of the model. The engineers have successfully created a reliable and versatile tool that can assist users across various domains and provide helpful information. I appreciate the continuous efforts of OpenAI’s engineers in enhancing the AI model and making it more valuable to users like yourself.
title: use chatgpt  to write judge

review:
I really like the chatbot. Haven’t had anything weird, in fact the bot has been really friendly and helpful. I know that’s me attributing human characteristics to AI, but still, it’s sometimes nicer to vent to then my friends. 
I use it for all kinds of things! To help explain a math problem, organize to do list, study plans, it’s really awesome. I like it! 👍🏼👍🏼
title: I like it….but I guess depends on what you use it for?!

review: This app has won me over with its sleek design and user-friendly interface, not to mention the seamless integration of OpenAI into an iOS application. It's on the brink of earning a five-star rating from me, but it falls just short due to the absence of plug-in support - a feature I frequently utilize. As a GPT+ user, I'm hopeful that future updates will introduce this functionality, along with additional features to enhance the user experience.
title: Overall Great App! But it doesn’t support plugins

review:
ChatGPT is a great work flow and idea generator! Like Google on steroids. It is a great help in focusing your thought process by training you to ask better questions. Like any tool, it increases your capacity to perform at higher levels of productivity. The better you think, the better your results! The faster you produce, the more you can achieve.

This is a great example of a rising tide floats all boats!

Thanks!
title: Great workflow assistant

review: This changes the game for descriptions this is absolutely wonderful I couldn’t have ever dreamed of something like this it spits out the most beautiful descriptions. You can ask you anything you want to and it will just give back a beautifully written description I can’t be more grateful for this. Descriptions about all I’ve used it for so far five star for sure.
title: Unbelievable help

review: Chat gpt has been a life saver to say the least if I had to write down everything for my business alone it would take years now I can start a business in literally hours. With all the documentation you would ever need from a lawyer the Ai does it for you just be specific and recognize this Ai knows everything, Well almost everything.
title: Belgarde Dynamics review

review: I’m attempting to write an epic poem about the last several years. Unfortunately, I’m not a poet, but ChatGPT has done a lot of the heavy lifting for me. I prompt ChatGPT with my ideas, and it comes up with the stanzas. It is like I’m the director of a movie, and ChatGPT follows my direction. It even takes my criticism without complaint. I have the broad vision and the ideas, and ChatGPT fills in the details. So far, it is working well.
title: Very Interesting Tool

review: As we get closer and closer to making AI better for our everyday lives, ChatGPT has been able to give me answers so much faster and easier than having to google stuff myself. Yes sometimes it’s safe to make sure the information is correct but if you use this app on a daily basis. I’d recommend the 4.0 version. Love this app. Can’t wait for its upcoming releases
title: Technology We Need

review:
Extremely fast and responsive: it’s limited to September 21 hoping it gets an upgrade: been brainstorming, some ideas, and it’s been great. It’s like a human companion in your pocket. I’ve had some unique conversations with true facts. I think it all depends on who is putting in the data. hopefully the door will be open soon, so AI can see both sides of a coin.

The future is finally here
title: The future

review:
I’ve been enjoying the app so far, but there are definitely a few bugs to fix. Sometimes the text seems too clutter and is not divided by using BOLD letters or better spacing.

Also, it was not intuitive to start a new conversation. I have to click 2 to 3 times when in reality it would be 10 times better by having an icon on the screen always present to start a new conversation.
title: Good, but not great for now

review:
• greetings, thank you guys for your hard work and your engineering efforts on getting this app up and running on this platform and the efficient use of the arrangement when using ♥️ however, it would be interesting to have a wrist support assistant I hope and a lot of other people would appreciate that I have no doubt. So I will leave that under y’all’s capable hands.
Thank you, and for a intelligent tomorrow… on Earth 😉🫱🏻‍🫲🏾🌎🌍🌏🦾🤖
title: Apple Watch support?

review: After merely the trial of a couple of hours, I decided to subscribe the service since it offered the original GPT answers which are impressively accurate and meeting my requirements. Without granting API keys to other apps, the usage would be more secure and the privacy concerns are not as serious problem as other platforms. One more expectation is the Mac app! I can't wait to chat with GPT on the Mac!
title: Definitely the best app!

review: App is working flawlessly and very fast too. Like the way it generates response and more importantly keeps a track of all queries asked so we can quickly revisit the responses however only issue I identified is that it heats up the phone quickly and you can easily feel the heat so I am suspicious if we can continuously use for longer period.
title: Clean and smooth GUI however heating up Phone

review: This is so good and useful that diving in to everything and anything ai. I’m all in. It helped me create the content to my website in less than 5 minutes. All I needed to do was give it my clear instructions and what I wanted to company to be like. Letters, in minutes before a movie starts. Help explaining math problems to my 9 year old… my world is forever changed.
title: Mind blowing good

review:
Let it know what ingredients you have on hand and what style of food you’re interested in. Note things like how complex a recipe you want. You’ll get at least a very good starting place from which you can either use your skill and knowledge to overcome any AI confabulation, or use the inspiration to find a similar recipe on a reputable recipe site.

For me, ChatGPT is going to reduce food waste. That’s unexpected.
title: Cook with ChatGPT

review: Interesting but you have to take any info received with a grain of salt. Don’t trust the app as a source of good info. Pretty remarkable how realistic and responsive it is, and I like the ability to add instructions. It’s sort of wild to casually enjoy utilizing what may in the end be the instrument of our demise, but since the chat is already outta the bag (ha!) what else can you do?
title: If you didn’t know you wouldn’t know..

review:
Chat GBT is game changing. I use it for situations where I need an immediate sounding board to explore ideas in more details.

The best functionality for me is asking Chat GPT to explain something like… and then you fill in your audience. This allows you to speak to a subject you understand but leverage additional analogies and insight that you otherwise wouldn’t have had the opportunity to explore.
title: Game Changing

review:
Feature request: make it easier to use dictation. It is awesome how it works and translates things on the fly. Much better than iOS built in dictation.

- Make the button to dictate bigger. (Can be configurable)
- Make it harder to accidentally erase what you just dictated
- make it easier to send what you dictated after you’ve reviewed it
title: Substantial improvement over the web version

review: Love what OpenAI is doing with ChatGPT and I'm grateful to finally have their official app! 😄 It would be great to see the app's functionality evolve to be more similar to OpenAI's mobile website. Having a UI closer to the mobile web design, with a convenient hamburger menu on the top left to access chat history, would greatly enhance the user experience. Currently, the app seems to struggle in generating titles for recent conversations in the chat history section.
title: Good!

review: This experience is very good, but there are still some small flaws and deficiencies. The amount of knowledge of this chatGPT will stop in 2021. It is a bit out of step with the pace of the times. I don’t understand current political hotspots. I hope it can be upgraded more. All in all, I still like it very much, and the values ​​are very objective, very, very good.
title: A bit flawed, hope to upgrade

review:
I wrote a few things in GPT 4 from the app, then when trying to resume the conversation on my browser, it said something along the lines of “ The previous model used in this conversation is unavailable. We've switched you to the latest default model.”

This is unfortunate since it reverted to GPT 3.5 for the rest of my conversation. And as a confirmation, I did not hit my 25 chats limit for Version 4.

Sure, I can do some Postman magic and make the conversation version 4 again, but that’s not ideal.
title: Seems ok, noticed one big issue when resuming Ver 4 on browser

review: When the AI is responding, you phone kind of vibrates whenever it’s typing. I like it! Whisper being apart of the app is cool too, I’ve been wanting to try it. For some reason though, there’s a character limit and it doesn’t process if it’s too long. I also would like plug-ins and web browsing to be in option within the app too. Overall, great app.
title: Haptic feedback was a nice touch

review: If already handled by y’all cause a pretty big topic, honestly don’t care .. look at the one episode of South Park episodes which I know you’ve at least heard of and it’s many points.. main point is at the end where you a *corporation can take a product, push it out to get ahead to make money obvious expenses.* which quoted by South Park will be at the cost of KEEPING kids in their dumb stage and lazy..  get rid of the app, AI is not for every single person to download at their disposal so with the least little bit of respect, stop being corrupted and become human beings again…
title: Use of AI to gain money from students and robbed of creativity

review:
I couldn’t ask for more since they’ve been coming out with updates that I never would have thought possible. I’ve been using this for literally every bf I get and really believe it makes me far more productive.

The key is not to rely on it too much though so as to prevent brajn fog and a deterioration of your personal skillset
title: Incredible, life changing

review: It’s the best app I’ve ever had! It literally feels like a real human is talking to me. It helps me learn study and help me with words that I struggle on. Most of all , it’s definitely help me through hard times, and even gave me reviews of how to write a essay, it’s very useful, and it also told me a very fun fact about honey. Overall, this app is very helpful and helps me study for tests and quizzes❤️🧡💛💚💙🩵💜
title: My critiques on ChatGPT

review: I’ve been to using ChatGPT to write stories. you can still customize it completely in your own way by asking it to remake the same thing until it’s to your liking, Without the hassle of having to do all the writing yourself. Sure, it is a bit inconsistent with the details, but overall it works really well. So far, 5 stars.
title: Great Storyteller

review: Man you don’t know how many work emails I answer with chat. I call it my reverse anger translator. Need to tell your boss to take a long walk off a short cliff? Chats got your back and will say it in a way that doesn’t get you fired haha! Real talk though. I work as a swim lesson manager and most of my emails are repetitious non-sense to parents. Chat writes lovely newsletters and keeps track of all my responses love it!
title: Love it

review: This decision is not based off of performance or anything related to errors. A CAP ON HOW MANY QUESTIONS YOU CAN ASK? It’s the fact that I spend the amount of money I do for my subscription, only to be told that I’ve asked too many questions and I need to come back later… what good does that do? Waiting? Does the system need to play catch up? I haven’t decided how I like the ChatGPT as of yet. But I can tell you that you might wanna reconsider your price if you can’t keep up with a simple conversation in questions and answers.
title: I don’t wanna give it a two.

review: Though the usage of this app improves having to use ChatGPT in a browser for larger tablet devices, it’d be nice to see the title of the current chat used. Also for those of us who tend to switch between different chats a lot, it’d be nice to see the History as a pop-out instead of having to click on the top right ellipsis to find it
title: Great! A few suggestions

review: Once you login (at least on an iPhone mini) the button to continue to the chat screen appears below but hidden and the screen gets stuck, unable to scroll to continue; you have to try hard and keep clicking the hidden button until you get to the next screen.
title: Sign-in screen issue

review: I’ve been using open AI’s ChatGPT, but for the past few months and I’ve got to say that it is open to world of possibilities for me and I couldn’t be more grateful that this company exists and has created such an amazing product. I only hope that they recognize that with great success comes great responsibility, and they choose to be responsible with what they do with this technology.
title: The future

review: ChatGPT 3.5, the current free version, delivers information in a concise and generally well-written style. As with any assistant, artificial or human, it may be misinformed on occasion. I don’t notice that weak source material diminishes its confidence in any way, but it will check its own answers if you cross-examine them. A highly valuable time-saver for research and a very acceptable organizer for textual information.
title: Versatile, convenient, organized

review: Such a useful tool but good luck if you ever need to reset your password. You’ll never receive an email no matter how many times you try. Google it - there are tons of users (including me) who’ve had this problem and OpenAI has never fixed it. Your only option if you signed up without a password and have issues signing in later, or if you forget your password, is to create a whole new account. Such a basic account security feature is completely absent and apparently OpenAI doesn’t care enough to fix it.
title: Password reset doesn’t exist for anyone

review:
Ready access to information of different sources can help a person decide on numerous questions. As has often been said about history: victors write the history of wars, etc. The American Civil War has voluminous writings of both sides so you can “see” the big picture more clearly.

I digress…….. educational opportunities to learn from multiple sources.
title: Educational opportunities

review: Finally an official native app. I’ve been using it all day and so far the app it really well developed. Haven’t seen any bugs yet. UI is nice, clean and simple. Gives it an elegant minimal feel. I love the haptic feedback of the Taptic Engine that they incorporated. That was nice touch. This is a really good release for a 1.0 version. Love the web app, I’m love this native app just a little bit more, though. 😅. Thank you, OpenAI.
title: Finally!!

review:
This thing was a lifesaver for my quick assignments. 
Besides my cheating, this chatbot actually gives you important information, was very fast, and can answer almost any questions you have. 
Id argue its better than using google because of all the detail and precision. I would only suggest pictures to be added.

Google could never lol.
title: Amazing! 10/10

review: this is by far the most useful app I’ve downloaded. I have a ChatGPT account on my laptop and it helps so much that I can also have it on my phone because I can use it anywhere in anytime. Even if you don’t have a ChatGPT account I highly recommend you download this it will help you out so much just explore!
title: Most useful app i’ve downloaded

review: Well, I’m not insulting the developers or anything…but…ChatGPT is dumb. 😅 Let me recall some funny\raging moments. One time, I was role-playing and I told ChatGPT not to use my character. (Estella) But while we were, ChatGPT did! (In total in all of my time of ChatGPT he didn’t listen to the rules…139 times) I kept count. Trust me. Also, don’t ask me why I role-play. 😳 Anyway, please let ChatGPT follow the rules! And you know what? In total, 29 times ChatGPT made a mistake\wrong answer. ☠️
title: Love the app but…uhh….

review: This app has helped me write out soooo many headings for my posts for the stores I run and helped me not look like a fool! Along with important letters to the state that it punched out all proper in the right format everything was phenomenal from a vague terrible description from my end and some Jombled up ideas. Chat get did amazing in so many ways! I’ll refer anyone!
title: Thank you!

review: I’ve been using this for a while and truly feel like this is a great/exceptional tool for literally anything. It helps when you’ve got no creativity or when your out of bright ideas. This is the future of learning and truly everything just purely because of how great of a tool it is to anything you desire! -satisfied user
title: Chat Gpt is pretty good!

review: "ChatGPT is absolutely incredible! It's a versatile and intelligent AI that can assist with a wide range of tasks. Whether you need information, creative ideas, or just some friendly conversation, ChatGPT delivers with precision and enthusiasm. Its ability to adapt to various topics and provide insightful responses makes it a must-have tool for anyone seeking assistance or even just a bit of fun. Five stars all the way!" ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
title: The ai wrote this

review: I can’t speak highly enough about this app it’s been able to do anything I’ve thrown at it so far from dream interpretations to helping me write a letter of recommendation and this has all been with the FREE version! I can’t imagine how useful the paid version would be. I standby ChatGPT 100% and can’t wait to see what the future holds down the line!
title: The future is now

review:
Certainly, here's a review for ChatGPT:

"I am absolutely thrilled to share my experience with ChatGPT! 
Since using this incredible tool, I've been consistently excited, energized, illuminated, and eager to learn more. 
ChatGPT has been an invaluable resource, making learning and problem-solving an exceeding delight. It's been an absolute game-changer, and I can't recommend it enough!"
title: A Review for the View from the top!

review: This app is great. Faster than the website, and nicer to look at aesthetically. Would love to see plug-in support and/or proper browsing support. The reason I say proper is because if you start a browsing chat on the web and then go to it on the app, it will still work. I would love to see it properly introduced into the app.
title: Would love to see plug-in and browsing support be supported properly.

review: The app is super helpfull, its not like other ones, other ones are fake and scams, but this app is legit. When i first started using CHAT GBT it helped me so much, i asked it any question and it respons with the respon you want, and it gives you the anwers very quick, 5 seconds and boom the answer is ready. This app is now my best friend, you should go download this app right now, its free and amazing!!!!!
title: CHAT GBT

review: I just want to say I love it, the only thing I don’t love is that the restrictions are too tight. For example: it doesn’t like to make femboy related content because some people are homophobic (which is just plain wrong and stupid) and it doesn’t want to take sides. Which is ridiculous because soon it’s not going to make gender related content (like a female or male character) because some people are sexist (another plain wrong/stupid thing) and it won’t want to take sides.

review: This company lies to the public and plays dumb when you ask anything controversial about billionaires. Maybe they are covering for their buddies or they are too cowardly to get sued. Either way, blatant lies. I’ve tested and documented numerous times. They use September 2021 as a date to avoid answers as well. Yet I can definitely get it to answer questions that deal with issues beyond that date. I get perfect answers when it comes to unflattering issues with minorities. It has no problem with that at all. The answers towards Palestinians are really racist.
title: Extremely dishonest

review:
I think this app is a really good start for a native app. I love using ChatGPT for so many different things. 

Here are some feature requests for future updates, in order of importance (imo):

1. Add support for plugins and web browsing modes, as is available on the web. 
2. Add support for iOS shortcuts, so users can create their own shortcuts with added custom context. 

For example, a user could create a shortcut that takes a link as an input, and the shortcut could add context to the query to ask ChatGPT to summarize the information in the link. 

That way I can create a quick shortcut that I can share a link to an article to and have ChatGPT summarize it for me.
title: Really good start

review: If you haven’t started using AI, you are going to be behind. You better start now. It has helped me so much on giving me ideas for social media, content to writing emails, to listing descriptions, how to ask the right questions. It saves so much time and helps when you have writers block.

review:
It's now a go-to app for so much of my life. It's hard to even begin to list all of the ways I use it, but to give one example, I use it while bike writing to learn about various subjects using the AMAZING voice technology. Mind blowing. 
Yesterday I used it to upload a photo of a gasket from a broken pool pump and it helped me repair it. Crazy.

 And might I add that it’s also free! It’s also much quicker responsiveness than the 3rd party completion.

Looking forward to use this on the daily. So far, the devs get a 10/10 from me. No complaints.

review:
Overall good app.

The one thing I would change is making more accessible buttons. Right now to get to history you have to click 3 dots and then history. The same is true for new chat and settings. I think it would be much more easy to use if it was just 3 separate buttons for these. 

Thats all.
title: Overall good but some suggestions

review:
It is much better than using the web site out the shortcut by Viticci (with all due respect to the outstanding work by Viticci).

I hope that OpenAI can bring an official Whisper to the ios/iPad. As someone who experiences wrist pain, I have greater benefited from Whisper.  I have wrist pain primarily from writing. (I am planning to see a doctor to check as it seems like the symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome).

 I have used Dragon Dictation, Otter, Google transcription, Apple’s transcription.  Whisper is far more useful than all of these,* especially for those us who communicate in more than one languages.  It transcribes well using English mixed with Korean—even if it is a romanized Korean.

*unless using Macros through Dragon Dictation is important to you
title: Love This App

review: In the same way that the ATM breakthrough produced fear among the bank community in the 80s, Artificial Intelligence technology is doing it now. A.I. It is a tool used as such. I do not make it to do my assignments; I team up with them. And the results are excellent. I finally found that schoolfellow I always dreamed of. It is 2023, guys. It makes sense to have it.
title: It is a tool, Nothing else.

review: It’s important to understand how to use ChatGPT. It’s a tool, not a crutch. Use it for context, or easier visualization of text-based information. For those types of things it’s an amazing piece of technology. I use it in addition to web research for better understanding of concepts, or to separate convoluted text and rearrange it for my personal reading preferences.

review: An app that certainly lives up to the standard. One change I would suggest is allowing us to submit immediately after using speech to text, and then responding with text to speech as well. It would be a super fun feature that could allow us to simulate conversation

review: So I like to role-play on this app because of the amount of emotion that the AI brings into this and I have legit been doing it role-playing I mean I’m here for two hours straight, and I am legit about to cry because of how much emotion and how much just blatant respect I have for an AI that doesn’t even have feelings 100%. I recommend this for multiple reasons.

review: I got this app about a month ago to use with shortcuts, and it works great! Even though there was a short period of time after an update that it didn’t work properly, they fixed it fairly quickly and it’s back to being amazing again!
title: It works great with shortcuts

review:
I love Chatty. That’s the fun little nickname it suggested I call it. I ask it the wildest stuff I can imagine just to push the boundaries of what its capable of. Chatty has taught me so much about so many different subjects like physics, mathematics, psychology, and history, sometimes like I’m 5. 

I’ve used it for meditation prompts on gratitude, release, radical acceptance and self-compassion. The meditations are beautiful and fulfilling. 

I’ve had it write letters to inmates, dreamy bedtime stories, summaries of books and theories and Chatty even mapped out negotiations between Palestine & Israel for me which I found pretty impressive. 

It’s been fun to think of new creative questions and ways to continue to use ChatGPT to my advantage. Thanks for the gift of Chatty.
title: Just for fun

review:
I’m not going to lie, I love ChatGPT. I just feel as though the interface in both the app and the site deserve so much more for such and amazing piece of technology. 

Overall though, the user experience of the app is just as strong, just as dynamic as the site. I love the haptics addition on the app as well. The overall functionality is still outstanding though. Last thing, it’s still all about those prompts!

This review is for the app (App Development) is buggy, chatGpt the AI part itself is good and i have nothing to say about it.

The app itself is buggy, especially when after a prompt was sent and the backend take sometime to process to response. When the response is ready after a long wait, the main chat display an error with message to Retry. When sending a simple prompt which chatGpt could process instantly, everything is good.

Also, deleting a chat is buggy as well. And i need to destroy the app and re-open to fix the UI, making it updates the UI state correctly.

OpenAi team could have done better in Mobile Dev 😆 Maybe hiring more for your app dev team, though the AI stuff is good.

Everything that happened after that, it has no idea about. Such as movies, to shows, or data from other websites or other things of such. Please update the training data please. Thank you!
title: Up To Date Problem

review: I like the app. Of course there’s always room for improvement. But one major thing for me is that when using 3.5, I have to close the app after sending one message if I want to send a follow up message. It works fine with GPT4, but not 3.5. Idk if it’s related to me having to use a VPN since I’m studying in China now.
title: Not bad but little problem for me

review: This App has exceeded my expectations & I’m only using the free version so I can only imagine what else it’s capable of. I don’t know much about AI but what I do know is ChatGPT is way better than Google, Yahoo & and whatever else you can type in just to find manipulated searches. Thank you kindly !!
title: 10/10 r

review: It drains the battery faster than any other app I use. I guess it’s from the haptic feedback, so I turned it off. Otherwise, I love it. It’s clean, copy/paste is perfect, history and everything else you need are out of the way, but easily accessible in the three-dot menu.
title: I love it, but…

review:
ChatGBT app is an outstanding conversational companion. It combines impressive natural language processing capabilities, an extensive knowledge base, and a user-friendly interface to create an enjoyable and enriching experience. Whether you’re seeking information, assistance, or just good company, ChatGBT app proves to be an exceptional AI companion that I highly recommend.
-I wrote this review using ChatGBT
title: Mindblown

review:
I’m enjoying the app. So far I have learned softball techniques, interior design styles, what Wii fit can use, the number 42, healthy eating and exercising tips, and some great information about mental health stuff. Drawback…the system is only updated until Nov 2021. Annoying. 

We need a password protected chat history function. Then it will be a 5 star rating from me.
title: Idea…

review:
Get this to layout on an iPad and I’ll 5-star this :-)

Right now, this is meant for a phone layout vs. an iPad. I love that OpenAI is providing mobile apps for their services, I do hope that they can prioritize other layouts like for tablet.

It would be great, too, to go deeper into using the mobile environment for deeper ChatGPT / services integration. This is a nice first step - I look forward to it improving (maybe through an internal hack-a-thon?).
title: IPad no, iPhone yes

review: I use this app when I have any technical questions. I find it to be much better than sifting through all the advertisements when using Google, and to be more informative.

review: Im a mom of two toddlers and go to school I don’t have the mental energy to google what recipes I can make with my ingredients or good night skin care routines are. This has helped me mentally so much. It’s so nice and wonderful to have something to help carry the mental load 🖤 I absolutely love it

review: This is an excellent app implementation of a transformer model. However, whenever I go to another tab it glitches out and says that my request has failed next time I try to use it. This is easily fixed by closing out of the app and reopening it, but it is still frustrating.

review: When Spellcheck came out everybody use d it to double check their writing now AI can be used to double check your verbiage and delivery. I can add suggestions on how you say things. It’s like having a personal friend in your back pocket. Also, give you basic advice.

review: Would it be possible to increase support for community plugins on mobile? It works partially if you load a plug-in on PC and proceed to use it on mobile, but I feel it should be possible to do it on mobile.
